{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3329258,"name":"Benjamin Miller ","username":"BenjaminMiller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/benjaminmiller/{size}/193876_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T19:27:27.791Z","cooked":"

Hi CD,

We are trying to create buttons to rotate out swerve drive to make it easier for our driver lining up with the amp. Are there any techniques to use or example code?

Our code: GitHub - FireIslandFRC/PathPlannerTest2024 at RobotDraft
PS be warned our code has some things named incorrectly because of quick changes at our comp.

Thank you.

i was playing with something similar in my code. My team does not have a camera to align with the speaker, so we used trigonometry to try to do this.
to go to the correct position, we set a button that, when pressed, set the tetha axis on chassisSpeeds to be a PID calculation based on the angle of the robot and the setpoint.
we had made a method to calculate the setpoint in the swervesubsystem.

this did not work because the robot had a lot af drift, making it impossible to be exact. but if you have a limelight for example, you can use it and substitute my trigonometric attempt with it and use PID to align.

sorry for the English, i’m from Brazil

You can use a PIDController or ProfiledPIDController to get to the rotation you want.

Make the controller’s setpoint the angle you want. Pass the rotation from your robot’s estimated pose into the calculate() method. Finally, use the result to set a rotation speed for your drivetrain.
